content.title: Financial Assistance for Education- Haryana Silicosis Board
content.beneficiary: Children of workers suffering from silicosis
content.details: The “Financial Assistance for Education” scheme is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹5,000/- to ₹12,000/- per year is given to the children of workers who are suffering from silicosis as confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana. Assistance is provided to children studying from Class I to Master’s Degree, with assistance available for up to two boys and up to three girls of the affected workers, irrespective of the order of birth.
benefits: Financial assistance for education will be given to the children of workers at the following rates:
eligibility: The applicant/worker should be employed in a factory or at a construction site.
The worker who is suffering from silicosis as confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana are eligible to apply under this scheme for their children.
The worker should be registered with the Haryana Silicosis Board.
The children of workers should be studying in a class ranging from Class I to Master’s Degree.
Assistance will be available for up to two boys and up to three girls of affected workers, regardless of the order of birth of the children.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. The applicant may visit the nearest Labour Office and collect the application form. The Application Performa may also be downloaded from the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.
documents_required: Medical Report (X-Ray, CT Scan, Medical Prescription, Any Other)
General Document ( ESI Card, Any Other)

faqs.question: Who is eligible for assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Workers who are suffering from silicosis, confirmed by the Silicosis Diagnosis Board, Haryana, are eligible to apply for their children.

faqs.question: What type of financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance ranging from ₹5,000/- to ₹12,000/- per year is provided to eligible children of affected workers.

faqs.question: How many children of affected workers can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Up to two boys and up to three girls of the affected workers are eligible for assistance, irrespective of the order of birth.

faqs.question: What are the symptoms of silicosis?
faqs.answer: Symptoms of silicosis include associated T.B., shortness of breath, fatigue, loss of appetite (anorexia), chest pain with dry, non-productive cough (Whooping Cough), respiratory failure, and eventually, it can lead to death.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: To apply for the scheme benefits, eligible applicants can visit the nearest Antyodaya Kendra or Labour Office and fill up the application form.

faqs.question: Is silicosis a notifiable disease in Haryana?
faqs.answer: Yes, silicosis is a notifiable disease in Haryana under the Factories Act of 1948 and the Building and Other Construction Workers (RE & CS) Act of 1996.
